title: [BUG] SKCanvasView ignores WidthRequest?
body:
**Description**

It seems like the canvas view always use all of the horizontal space which is available. It seems like WidthRequest is ignored. Is this by design? So I need custom logic to work around it?

**Expected Behavior**

WidthRequest is honored.

**Actual Behavior**

WidthRequest is not honored

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
This all depends on the container. If it is in a `StackLayout`, then yes it fills the width. Unless you also set the `HorizontalOptions` to `Center`, `Start` or `End`. The default is to stretch.

Do you have an example of how you are using the canvas in the layout?

comments.author: LegendaryB
comments.body: Yeah seems correct. And also makes Sense. Was Not thinking about that

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Has your issue been resolved? Cane we close this?

comments.author: LegendaryB
comments.body: Yeah it was resolved. I close it. Thank you
